steps.content: Log in to your Canvas administrator account for your institution.
Go to Admin > Developer Keys (sometimes under Settings > Developer Keys).
Click "+ Developer Key" and choose "API Key" or "LTI Key" depending on your setup.
Give the key a name and set the required redirect URIs and scopes (at minimum: read access to courses and assignments as needed).
Save the developer key. Copy the Client ID and Client Secret (or the generated API token) and paste them into the fields below in Academia.
If using OAuth, follow your institution's OAuth flow to authorize Academia to access Canvas on behalf of a user.
Log in to your Brightspace (D2L) administrator account or obtain access from your institution's Brightspace admin.
Go to Admin Tools > API Management (or the OAuth2/Developer settings page).
Create a new application/client and provide a name and redirect URI for Academia.
Set the necessary scopes/permissions for reading courses and assignments (consult your Brightspace admin for exact scope names).
Save the application and copy the Client ID and Client Secret into the fields below in Academia.
Complete the OAuth2 flow in Academia to authorize access for your account or a user with the required privileges.
Go to the Google Cloud Console and create a new project.
In the navigation menu, go to "APIs & Services" > "Library".
Search for "Google Classroom API" and enable it for your project.
Go to "APIs & Services" > "Credentials".
Click "Create Credentials" and choose "API key".
Copy the generated API key and paste it into the field below.
Go to api.slack.com/apps and click "Create New App".
Choose "From scratch", name your app "Academia", and select your workspace.
In the sidebar under "Features", navigate to "OAuth & Permissions".
Scroll down to "Bot Token Scopes" and add the scopes you need (e.g., `channels:read`, `chat:write`).
At the top of the "OAuth & Permissions" page, click "Install to Workspace".
Copy the "Bot User OAuth Token" that is generated. This is your API key.
